DOC.brief_summary: This single ascend dose study determine evaluate safety tolerability TRN-157 approximately 40 healthy subject .
DOC.brief_title: Single Ascending Dose Study TRN-157 Healthy Subjects
DOC.criteria: 1 . Subject provide write informed consent 2 . The subject male female 18 65 year age 3 . If subject subject 's partner childbearing potential , medically acceptable form contraception 4 . Nonsmoker 5 . Good general health 6 . Willing abstain alcohol , caffeine , xanthinecontaining beverage 7 . The subject compliant available throughout entire study period 1 . Current diagnosis , per subject investigator screen assessment , : 1. unstable uncontrolled disease organ system ( include cardiovascular ) present therapy 2. history narrow angle glaucoma 3. history alcohol abuse within past 5 year 4. history smoking within past 6 month 5. positive result alcohol and/or drug abuse 6. weight > 100 kg < 50 kg 7. clinically significant abnormal ECG 8. history clinically significant ( per Investigator ) disease disorder 9. clinically significant abnormality clinical chemistry , hematology , urinalysis result 10 . Abnormal vital sign define follow : Systolic blood pressure ≥ 140 mmHg Diastolic blood pressure ≥ 90mmHg 2 . Heart rate < 40 > 85 beat per minute 3 . Fever clinically significant physical exam finding 4 . Current history clinically significant respiratory disease , include asthma , emphysema , chronic bronchitis , cystic fibrosis 5 . History current symptom ( ) respiratory tract inflammation 6 . Inability perform reproducible spirometry accordance American Thoracic Society ( ATS ) guideline 7 . Abnormal FEV1 , FVC , FEV1/FVC ( FEV1 FVC < 80 % predict FEV1/FVC ratio < 0.7 ) 8 . FEV1 variability > 10 % study visit 9 . Female childbearing potential positive serum pregnancy test currently breastfeed 10 . Currently treat hypertension take medication affect blood pressure significantly 11 . Inability perform acceptable , quality serial spirometry study procedures 12 . Positive screen Hepatitis B surface antigen ( HBsAg ) , Hepatitis C antibody , HIV antibody
